intro: Hedyotis zanguebariae, commonly known as the coastal hedyotis, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of East Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has slender stems and narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Hedyotis zanguebariae plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small insects and birds.
